<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/delta-causes-fresh-lockdowns-higher-caseloads-across-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Covid Won’t Leave Us Alone
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/delta-causes-fresh-lockdowns-higher-caseloads-across-world?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Benedict Cumberbatch saying go away" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=380 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Us7JbfvCPbmCs/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Benedict Cumberbatch saying go away" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Us7JbfvCPbmCs/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hot girl summer has quickly transitioned to “warily watching Delta summer” as the highly contagious Covid-19 variant leads to higher case numbers and fresh lockdowns across the world. Here’s the latest.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Where curbs are being added </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Sydney, Australia</strong>, has been on lockdown since June 26 to slow a spike in cases, and regional leaders say the order <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-11/u-s-cases-swell-new-york-state-reports-one-death-virus-update?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could be extended</a> past the original expiration date on Friday. “We just want people to stay at home. The virus won’t spread if people don’t leave home,” New South Wales state Premier Gladys Berejiklian said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Dutch prime minister </strong>apologized for an “<a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-57811538?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">error of judgement</a>” when he lifted some pandemic restrictions three weeks ago. The country reinstituted curbs on eating and drinking establishments. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tokyo </strong>entered a state of emergency yesterday that will extend through the entire duration of the Olympics, and other parts of eastern Asia also reintroduced social distancing rules.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Boosters are here</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facing rising cases, this week Israel will become the first country in the world to administer a Covid-19 booster vaccine shot; it’ll be given to adults with serious preexisting conditions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Medical workers in Thailand who have already been given two doses of China’s Sinovac vaccine will also be <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-health-coronavirus-pandemic-7aa9d4f51d7c1d938e298e5d19bd3d65?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">given shots</a> of AstraZeneca’s vaccine as a booster. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the US, Dr. Fauci has said that booster shots <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/11/world/fauci-coronavirus-vaccine-booster-school-reopening.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">aren’t recommended right now</a> because a full vaccination regimen provides significant protection against serious illness.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But life goes on</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While some places like Australia are trying to stamp out every single case, other (more vaccinated) countries are accepting Covid as a fact of life. Britain said it would <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/as-delta-cases-surge-u-k-to-ditch-most-covid-19-restrictions-next-week-11626108048?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">continue with its plan</a> to drop nearly all Covid-19 restrictions next week, but warned its citizens to keep wearing masks indoors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the US, which is more or less fully reopened for business, cases rose 47% last week, the biggest increase since April 2020. Experts warn that the number of deaths could <a href="https://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2021/07/12/surprising-amount-of-deaths-will-soon-occur-in-these-us-regions-from-increased-covid-19-cases-expert-says/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">soon rise</a> in unvaccinated areas of the country, but for now they’re down 27% nationwide from two weeks ago. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/cuba-cracks-protests-wake-worst-economic-crisis-decades?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Cubans Make Themselves Heard
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/cuba-cracks-protests-wake-worst-economic-crisis-decades?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="TOPSHOT - Cubans are seen outside Havana's Capitol during a demonstratio..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NzQ5L3RvcHNob3QtY3ViYS1wb2xpdGljcy1kZW0uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Yamil Lage/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cuban police cracked down on protesters and blocked social media sites following this weekend’s demonstrations, which amounted to some of the largest anti-government protests in the country in decades. Thousands of Cubans <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/07/11/1015140038/demonstrators-in-havana-protest-shortages-rising-prices?utm_source=npr_newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_content=20210712&utm_term=5562130&utm_campaign=news&utm_id=58229737&orgid=309&utm_att1=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">marched</a> Sunday to protest food shortages, power outages, surging prices, and the government’s handling of the pandemic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cuba’s economy fell 11% in 2020, the biggest annual decrease in almost 30 years. The crisis has pushed people to the brink—it’s very rare to see protests of this scale in Cuba, a country where the Communist regime keeps a close eye on dissidents. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Biden voiced support for the protestors. “We stand with the Cuban people and their clarion call for freedom...from the decades of repression and economic suffering to which they have been subjected by Cuba’s authoritarian regime,” he said yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong><strong style="color:#000"> </strong>Since 1958, the US has introduced varying levels of trade bans with Cuba. President Obama <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/23/world/americas/un-resolution-cuba-embargo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">abstained</a> from a symbolic UN vote opposing the US’ embargo on Cuba for the first time in US history, signaling a move to repair relations. But when Trump took office, he took a harder line and placed more sanctions on the country. President Biden has yet to reverse any of the Trump admin’s decisions.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/years-allstar-game-gets-political?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The All-Star Game's New Digs
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/years-allstar-game-gets-political?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="All-Star Game in Denver" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NzUxL2FsbC1zdGFyX2dhbWVfaW5fZGVudmVyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Daniel Shirey/MLB Photos via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The MLB All-Star festivities have the makings of dramatic reality TV: a smashing start with the Home Run Derby, a comeback after last year’s cancellation, and a switcheroo with economic and political implications. Last night, a commercial paid for by the National Republican Senatorial Committee <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/07/12/1014649935/senate-politics-mlb-baseball-all-star-game-warnock-home-run-derby?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reminded</a> viewers that the game was <em>supposed</em> to take place in Georgia and blamed the “radical left woke crowd” for moving it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> In April, the MLB <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/02/mlb-moves-allstar-game-georgia-voting-rights-law?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> it was moving the All-Star Game from Georgia to Denver due to Georgia’s new voting law. The MLB said the law was at odds with the league's values and that it opposes restrictions on voting.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The MLB wasn’t the only corporate giant to publicly oppose the voting law. Delta and Coca-Cola, both based in Georgia, along with <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/31/business/voting-rights-georgia-corporations.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">72 Black executives</a> around the country, spoke out against Georgia's and all other laws that would make it harder for Black, Latino, and other minority populations to vote.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> A tourism board in Georgia said losing the game cost the state $100+ million in economic activity, though MLB estimates are slightly lower. Either way, Denver businesses are happy to play host.</p>

GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="a photo of iced coffee" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xODEwL3Jfci5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The price of arabica coffee beans hit its <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/coffee-prices-soar-after-bad-harvests-and-insatiable-demand-11626093703?mod=hp_lista_pos5" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highest level</a> in five years due to higher demand and a severe drought in Brazil, which is the world’s top coffee producer. Brazil’s harvest this year is expected to drop the most since 2003, per the USDA.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “I rather hate it and I would much prefer to spend my time on design and engineering, which is what intrinsically I like doing.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Elon Musk said in court yesterday that he <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/musk-testify-defense-teslas-26-bln-deal-solarcity-2021-07-12/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doesn’t actually like</a> being the CEO of Tesla, but he has to do it “or frankly Tesla is going to die.” Musk is being accused by Tesla shareholders of orchestrating a harmful, self-dealing takeover of SolarCity in 2016. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>How California ended up with a massive almond industry. <th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IPO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/grilling-companies-weber-traeger-prepare-ipo?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Grills Just Want to Have Fun
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="grill" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDg3L2JhcmJlY3VlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.halfhalftravel.com/photography.html" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Dan Gold</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two grillmakers, one mass-market and one high-tech, recently filed to go public after seeing one too many sad hot dogs on the Fourth of July.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Weber:</strong></span><span> Boasting 23% of the US grill market and a legacy that started marinating in the ’50s, Weber is the Mustang of grills. When the company filed for an IPO yesterday, it said that revenue for the six months ending March 31 </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/weber-ipo/update-2-outdoor-grills-maker-weber-files-for-u-s-ipo-idUSL4N2OO2LN?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grew 62%</a></span><span> annually to $963 million. It could go public at a valuation of up to $6 billion, per Bloomberg. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Traeger: </strong></span><span>While Weber made its name with classic charcoal domes, younger rival Traeger is known for its smart grills that cost up to $2,000. For that price, you get three tiers of wood-fired, stainless steel grilling action, all controllable by a smartphone or Apple Watch. Last week, Trager filed to </span><span><a href="https://www.deseret.com/utah/2021/7/8/22567238/utah-traeger-grills-launches-public-stock-offering-effort-skullcandy-jermey-andrus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">go public</a></span><span> and celebrated by </span><span><a href="https://www.engadget.com/traeger-grills-wireless-meat-thermometer-meater-acquisition-183944452.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">buying</a></span><span> app-connected meat thermometer company, Meater.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Grillmakers were positioned perfectly over the flame during the pandemic, when quarantined people fought boredom with hobbies like cooking. Speaking of, does anyone have a grilled banana bread recipe?</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>Today’s is especially delicious...<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/brew-mini-deliciousness?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">play it here</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Shark Week</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s Shark Week on Discovery, so naturally we’re going to ask you some questions about the TV show <em>Shark Tank</em>. Can you identify each shark from the clues below? Your choices are Mark Cuban, Kevin O’Leary, Robert Herjavec, Barbara Corcoran, Lori Greiner, and Daymond John.</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The richest of all the sharks</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Investor in Scrub Daddy, considered one of the most successful startups to come through </span><span><em>Shark Tank</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Campaigned to be the leader of the Conservative Party of Canada</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Barack Obama’s ambassador for global entrepreneurship</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Recognized as a global leader in information security</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sold their namesake real estate business for $66 million in 2001</span></li>
</ol>
</td>

width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHot girl summer has quickly transitioned to “warily watching Delta summer” as the highly contagious Covid-19 variant leads to higher case numbers and fresh lockdowns across the world. Here’s the latest.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhere curbs are being added \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSydney, Australia\u003c/strong\u003e, has been on lockdown since June 26 to slow a spike in cases, and regional leaders say the order \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-11/u-s-cases-swell-new-york-state-reports-one-death-virus-update?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecould be extended\u003c/a\u003e past the original expiration date on Friday. “We just want people to stay at home. The virus won’t spread if people don’t leave home,” New South Wales state Premier Gladys Berejiklian said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Dutch prime minister \u003c/strong\u003eapologized for an “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-57811538?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eerror of judgement\u003c/a\u003e” when he lifted some pandemic restrictions three weeks ago. The country reinstituted curbs on eating and drinking establishments. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTokyo \u003c/strong\u003eentered a state of emergency yesterday that will extend through the entire duration of the Olympics, and other parts of eastern Asia also reintroduced social distancing rules.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBoosters are here\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFacing rising cases, this week Israel will become the first country in the world to administer a Covid-19 booster vaccine shot; it’ll be given to adults with serious preexisting conditions.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMedical workers in Thailand who have already been given two doses of China’s Sinovac vaccine will also be \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-health-coronavirus-pandemic-7aa9d4f51d7c1d938e298e5d19bd3d65?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egiven shots\u003c/a\u003e of AstraZeneca’s vaccine as a booster. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the US, Dr. Fauci has said that booster shots \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/11/world/fauci-coronavirus-vaccine-booster-school-reopening.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earen’t recommended right now\u003c/a\u003e because a full vaccination regimen provides significant protection against serious illness.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut life goes on\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile some places like Australia are trying to stamp out every single case, other (more vaccinated) countries are accepting Covid as a fact of life. Britain said it would \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/as-delta-cases-surge-u-k-to-ditch-most-covid-19-restrictions-next-week-11626108048?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtinue with its plan\u003c/a\u003e to drop nearly all Covid-19 restrictions next week, but warned its citizens to keep wearing masks indoors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the US, which is more or less fully reopened for business, cases rose 47% last week, the biggest increase since April 2020. Experts warn that the number of deaths could \u003ca href=\"https://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2021/07/12/surprising-amount-of-deaths-will-soon-occur-in-these-us-regions-from-increased-covid-19-cases-expert-says/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esoon rise\u003c/a\u003e in unvaccinated areas of the country, but for now they’re down 27% nationwide from two weeks ago. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCuban police cracked down on protesters and blocked social media sites following this weekend’s demonstrations, which amounted to some of the largest anti-government protests in the country in decades. Thousands of Cubans \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/07/11/1015140038/demonstrators-in-havana-protest-shortages-rising-prices?utm_source=npr_newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_content=20210712\u0026utm_term=5562130\u0026utm_campaign=news\u0026utm_id=58229737\u0026orgid=309\u0026utm_att1=\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emarched\u003c/a\u003e Sunday to protest food shortages, power outages, surging prices, and the government’s handling of the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCuba’s economy fell 11% in 2020, the biggest annual decrease in almost 30 years. The crisis has pushed people to the brink—it’s very rare to see protests of this scale in Cuba, a country where the Communist regime keeps a close eye on dissidents. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePresident Biden voiced support for the protestors. “We stand with the Cuban people and their clarion call for freedom...from the decades of repression and economic suffering to which they have been subjected by Cuba’s authoritarian regime,” he said yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eSince 1958, the US has introduced varying levels of trade bans with Cuba. President Obama \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/23/world/americas/un-resolution-cuba-embargo.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eabstained\u003c/a\u003e from a symbolic UN vote opposing the US’ embargo on Cuba for the first time in US history, signaling a move to repair relations. But when Trump took office, he took a harder line and placed more sanctions on the country. President Biden has yet to reverse any of the Trump admin’s decisions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe MLB All-Star festivities have the makings of dramatic reality TV: a smashing start with the Home Run Derby, a comeback after last year’s cancellation, and a switcheroo with economic and political implications. Last night, a commercial paid for by the National Republican Senatorial Committee \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/07/12/1014649935/senate-politics-mlb-baseball-all-star-game-warnock-home-run-derby?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereminded\u003c/a\u003e viewers that the game was \u003cem\u003esupposed\u003c/em\u003e to take place in Georgia and blamed the “radical left woke crowd” for moving it.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e In April, the MLB \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/02/mlb-moves-allstar-game-georgia-voting-rights-law?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e it was moving the All-Star Game from Georgia to Denver due to Georgia’s new voting law. The MLB said the law was at odds with the league's values and that it opposes restrictions on voting.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe MLB wasn’t the only corporate giant to publicly oppose the voting law. Delta and Coca-Cola, both based in Georgia, along with \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/31/business/voting-rights-georgia-corporations.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e72 Black executives\u003c/a\u003e around the country, spoke out against Georgia's and all other laws that would make it harder for Black, Latino, and other minority populations to vote.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e A tourism board in Georgia said losing the game cost the state $100+ million in economic activity, though MLB estimates are slightly lower. Either way, Denver businesses are happy to play host.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" When the company filed for an IPO yesterday, it said that revenue for the six months ending March 31 \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/weber-ipo/update-2-outdoor-grills-maker-weber-files-for-u-s-ipo-idUSL4N2OO2LN?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrew 62%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e annually to $963 million. It could go public at a valuation of up to $6 billion, per Bloomberg. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTraeger: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile Weber made its name with classic charcoal domes, younger rival Traeger is known for its smart grills that cost up to $2,000.
